page.title: 09SECONDARY SCHOOLS
page.content: MOST OF THE SCHOOLS IN OUR AREA ARE RUN BY KINGSTON BOROUGH EDUCATION AUTHORITY WHICH,UNLIKE MANY OTHER LOCAL COUNCILS, HAS RETAINED THE 11+ EXAMINATION.THIS MEANS THAT OUR SECONDARY SCHOOLS ARE STILL SELECTIVE.IF CHILDREN PASS THE 11+ EXAMINATION THEY WILL GO TO EITHER TIFFIN BOYS OR TIFFIN GIRLS GRAMMAR SCHOOL;IF NOT THEY WILL GO TO ONE OF THE SECONDARY MODERN SCHOOLS IN THE AREA.SOME OF THESE ARE SINGLE SEX SCHOOLS LIKE TOLWORTH GIRLS,COOMBE GIRLS OR BEVERLEY BOYS.OTHERS ARE MIXED (CO-EDUCATIONAL)LIKE HOLLYFIELD OR FLEETWOOD. ONE SECONDARY SCHOOL IN THE KINGSTON AREA IS DUE TO CLOSE BEFORE THE END OF THE EIGHTIES.THIS IS BECAUSE OF GOVERNMENT SPENDING CUTS ON EDUCATION AND A DECLINE IN THE SCHOOL POPULATION.
